problem.markdown:
>>Over time, dams become less efficient at generating electricity because:<<
( ) methane release increases ( ) solar power becomes cheaper ( ) evapotranspiration decreases (x) siltation occurs behind the dam ( ) migrating fish can't get past the dam
[explanation] Siltation is the accumulation of silt that occurs when the flow of a river is slowed. In a reservoir behind a dam, silt that had been suspended in a flowing river settles to the bottom. If siltation continues, accumulating silt will render the reservoir much less efficient at generating electricity. [explanation]
